alert.note: Alert for Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264 (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 3:46PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A group of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Navajo and Coconino Counties for areas between Indian Wells and Wupatki National Monument through 430 PM MST... At 340 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a group of strong thunderstorms about 25 miles north of Winslow, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Localized flooding can occur, especially across low water crossings. Locations impacted include... Tolani Lake, Dilkon, Leupp, Castle Butte, Tees Toh, Sunrise, Cedar Springs, Seba Dalkai and Hopi Reservation. This includes the following highways... State Route 87 between mile markers 359 and 405. State Route 99 between mile markers 62 and 71. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Roads can become impassable due to mud.

area.areaDesc: Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264
